text:
cropped logo_screen_e.dds from textures/objects/screens.
in case you want a background https://t.co/5xl2yKWBU5

paper_poster_internet_usage_d.tex in the same folder.

FOLLOW THESE INTERNET RULES https://t.co/aeetWLojyw
laiha/batch01/danger_sign_large_hotline_warning_d.tex (cropped and rotated) https://t.co/3C4kJqfxgV

textures/helpers/notexturergb.tex 
OH NO MY TEXTURE IS NOT STREAMED https://t.co/GGyIakymhm
textures/debug/death_row_e.tex https://t.co/2oBQPrxOPB

maybe in an earlier (or prototype) version, you selected from a list of pictures?
and when they switched away from that, they forgot to delete out the old textures for it, and then didn't keep them updated with outfit changes
I think what happened was that they redesigned how the outfit-picking system worked. In the released game you pick from a list, with a live 3D preview. https://t.co/rECBydgkdp
extradimensional suit is basically completely redrawn https://t.co/568Tg3vKCo
expedition gear https://t.co/pquT8R8MpC
I think this is a version of the Tactical Response Outfit? They heavily redesigned this one. https://t.co/eSzortMtJ7
earlier version of the Civilian outfit? https://t.co/6faLSWljMS
the office assistant looks basically the same, although the belt buckle is different https://t.co/qfOAie1JhE

the candidate suit.
looks pretty similar, but no numbers on this version https://t.co/Wv4l22NmUv
here's the first one in this folder. You can tell which one it is, but the coloring is totally different! https://t.co/xuER3ZCaco
here's a selection of outfits to compare to https://t.co/z7p2kn39IO

compare that to how it actually looks in the game.
it's not just lit differently, there's fundamental texture/model differences. https://t.co/ZE0Dedm2DS

there's a set of images under uiresources/.../4k/.../outfits which I don't think are actually used in the game? they also seem to show versions of the outfits predating the ones seen in the game.
Like, this seems to be the janitor outfit: https://t.co/lM1UN7epS4

an interesting thing is that the propaganda posters all have mirrored versions. I don't know if this is a limitation of the engine, like they can't mirror textures by changing texture coords, but whatever. So most of them are just mirrored, except this one: the text is different https://t.co/2xn9OBOkiT
his life is in your hands https://t.co/mDbwUNuYk0
I hate it when my office disappears https://t.co/rxqGa7nORJ

DO AS YOU'RE TOLD
DON'T EAT MOLD https://t.co/PcuhfDh6Cq

Anyway here's the Avoid Modern Technology poster extracted from the datafiles.
In case you want to print it out and hang it up next to your 486 https://t.co/o8AF1eDwRo
every one of these search terms is USELESS

man I think the biggest mindfuck of Control is how it's completely impossible to search any resources on it.
the game is called "control", it stores files in "packfiles", and the texture format is called "tex"
